all.Name: 1930s Antique French Carved Leg Flip-Top Game Table
all.Body:
Characterized by the French-inspired cabriolet legs, this rare card table is a simple exquisite example of the wealth of perspective that was considered in designing a piece. The simple top is a rich selection with a dense grain that glows in the polished patina of the single plank. Typical of the form, the back leg swings outward on knuckle joints The simple rounded edge and restrained approach to decoration speak to the taste of the original owner of the table, clearly someone with a well developed taste for the latest forms but with a more conservative eye for surface decoration.

all.Name: 1950s Hans J. Wegner Sawbuck Chairs - Set of 6
all.Body:
Hans J. Wegner for Carl Hansen & Søn, set of six 'Sawbuck' CH29 chairs, oak, teak, Denmark, 1952. This set of six chairs is designed by Hans J. Wegner for Carl Hansen. This chair holds a very strong construction even though it has a simplistic design. The chair only consists of eight parts. The chairs are defined by the V-shaped gaps in the backrest. The chair has a slightly slanted position, making the chair more comfortable than it looks. A number of chairs by Wegner are called sawbuck chairs, or 'bukkestole' in Danish. These chairs, which are closely related to folding chairs, but yet fixed in an open position. The chair is defined by the A-shaped frame that can be seen from the side. The name derives from the shape that sawbucks or sawhorses in his workshop. The sawbuck shape was something that many cabinetmakers were very interested in. The design is very strong and simple and only demands a few part and little material.

This pendant, model Verona was designed by Svend Middelboe in the 1970s and manufactured by the Danish lighting company Nordisk Solar. It is made from white lacquered metal and consists of five shades. A page from a Dutch lighting catalogue from the 1970s explains the design in more detail: "The individual shades of this lamp are arranged funnel-shaped towards the inside; they are so positioned that the light is reflected at the top and bottom of the shades. The reflection provides evenly light distribution at the surface of the lamp and supplies harmonic transparency of shape and light."

all.Name: Danish Mid-Century Mirror with Teak Shelf
all.Body:
A solid teak Mid-century Danish mirror with petite shelf.
Each element of the teak mirror has a wonderful grain and patina.
The mirror hangs securely from two holes with metal supports on the reverse of the mirror at the top. There are also holes which travel through the corners of the mirror which means the mirror could be fixed extremely securely.
The nicely rounded geometrics of the rectangular shape mirror are typical of the modernist aesthetic of the mid-twentieth century. The mirror would look great in a room with other vintage pieces from the 1950s and 60s in any room of the house.

all.Name: Mid-century Danish mirror with petite shelf in teak
all.Body:
A solid teak Mid-century Danish mirror with petite shelf.
Each element of the teak mirror has a wonderful grain and patina.
The mirror hangs securely from two holes with metal supports on the reverse of the mirror at the top. There are also holes which travel through the corners of the mirror which means the mirror could be fixed extremely securely.
The nicely rounded geometrics of the rectangular shape mirror are typical of the modernist aesthetic of the mid-twentieth century. The mirror would look great in a room with other vintage pieces from the 1950s and 60s in any room of the house.
H 32.75 X D 5 X W 14.25

all.Name: Mogens Ballin vase
all.Body:
VERY RARE Mogens Ballin Pewter Vase – 1920 – Georg Jensen Very beautiful and rare art nouveau / arts and crafts danish and pewter vase by Mogens Ballin from Copenhagen. Georg Jensen worked as a silversmith from ca. 1901 – 1904 at Mogens Ballins workshop. Georg Jensens later design was under much influence of Mogens Ballin and the other designers at the workshop. Den dansih silversmith continued Ballins workshop in 1907 and changed the name to Hertz-Ballin. Just Andersen was amongst the artist working in Ballins workshop after 1907. Marked: “HB” – for Hertz-Ballin “2019” – the ligature mark for production year 1920. “Danmark”.   
H 6.5 in  X D 4.15 in X W 4.15 in

all.Name: Vintage Mid-Century Lyfa Light Danish Design Model 3050 Sconce
all.Body:
The lamp is entirely made of (now cream) white coated metal with the front shade part in a racetrack shape with cut outs on the top and bottom.

This shade is connected to a diamond shaped wall fixture with rivets. It can hinge over about 40 degrees either way from the wall fixture creating for more light to shine upwards or downwards (or to the left and right if you would hang this lamp in a horizontal position!).

The lamp has a great graphic light effect. It is a sober lamp, well designed and perfectly fitting in the Scandinavian modern design legacy.

This 3050 model seems to have been quite successful at the time. It was made in many colors and was probably in production for well over a decade.

It first came to market in the 1970s. We date the one on offer here to the late 1970s to mid 1980s.

This 3050 follows in a longer line of mid century design classic wall lights by Lyfa, most notably the Peacock, Kvadrille and Septet wall lights by Bent Karlby.

There is no designer noted for the 3050 and we doubt greatly that it is (also) by Karlby.

The bulb holder is attached to the wall fixture. The wall fixture has two key hole cut outs by which it can be hung over two screws in your wall.

The lamp takes 1 E14 bulb with screw type fitting

decorative-objects.Body:
VERY RARE Mogens Ballin Pewter Vase – 1920 – Georg Jensen Very beautiful and rare art nouveau / arts and crafts danish and pewter vase by Mogens Ballin from Copenhagen. Georg Jensen worked as a silversmith from ca. 1901 – 1904 at Mogens Ballins workshop. Georg Jensens later design was under much influence of Mogens Ballin and the other designers at the workshop. Den dansih silversmith continued Ballins workshop in 1907 and changed the name to Hertz-Ballin. Just Andersen was amongst the artist working in Ballins workshop after 1907. Marked: “HB” – for Hertz-Ballin “2019” – the ligature mark for production year 1920. “Danmark”.   
H 6.5 in  X D 4.15 in X W 4.15 in

lighting.Body:
This pendant, model Verona was designed by Svend Middelboe in the 1970s and manufactured by the Danish lighting company Nordisk Solar. It is made from white lacquered metal and consists of five shades. A page from a Dutch lighting catalogue from the 1970s explains the design in more detail: "The individual shades of this lamp are arranged funnel-shaped towards the inside; they are so positioned that the light is reflected at the top and bottom of the shades. The reflection provides evenly light distribution at the surface of the lamp and supplies harmonic transparency of shape and light."

lighting.Name: Vintage Mid-Century Lyfa Light Danish Design Model 3050 Sconce
lighting.Body:
The lamp is entirely made of (now cream) white coated metal with the front shade part in a racetrack shape with cut outs on the top and bottom.

This shade is connected to a diamond shaped wall fixture with rivets. It can hinge over about 40 degrees either way from the wall fixture creating for more light to shine upwards or downwards (or to the left and right if you would hang this lamp in a horizontal position!).

The lamp has a great graphic light effect. It is a sober lamp, well designed and perfectly fitting in the Scandinavian modern design legacy.

This 3050 model seems to have been quite successful at the time. It was made in many colors and was probably in production for well over a decade.

It first came to market in the 1970s. We date the one on offer here to the late 1970s to mid 1980s.

This 3050 follows in a longer line of mid century design classic wall lights by Lyfa, most notably the Peacock, Kvadrille and Septet wall lights by Bent Karlby.

There is no designer noted for the 3050 and we doubt greatly that it is (also) by Karlby.

The bulb holder is attached to the wall fixture. The wall fixture has two key hole cut outs by which it can be hung over two screws in your wall.

The lamp takes 1 E14 bulb with screw type fitting
6ʺW × 3ʺD × 8ʺL
Free delivery for the U.S

mirrors.Name: Danish Mid-Century Mirror with Teak Shelf
mirrors.Body:
A solid teak Mid-century Danish mirror with petite shelf.
Each element of the teak mirror has a wonderful grain and patina.
The mirror hangs securely from two holes with metal supports on the reverse of the mirror at the top. There are also holes which travel through the corners of the mirror which means the mirror could be fixed extremely securely.
The nicely rounded geometrics of the rectangular shape mirror are typical of the modernist aesthetic of the mid-twentieth century. The mirror would look great in a room with other vintage pieces from the 1950s and 60s in any room of the house.
H 26.50 X D 5 X W 13.75
Free local pick up

This is not your everyday trumpet-shaped light, minimalist lines and perfect craftsmanship make the solid teak wooden top merge into the aluminum core of this light. Clearly, this is a high-end pendant lamp, the seamlessly folded edges are a perfect example of its quality. This light provides mostly downward light and is very suitable to light a room when hung high. It would also feel at home over a large dining table since this light is over 18in in diameter. The combination of materials used contribute to the overall Scandinavian feel and would certainly complement your modern interior.

seating.Name: 1940s Frits Henningsen Wingback Armchair
seating.Body:
This rare wingback chair was designed and made by Danish cabinetmaker Frits Henningsen in the mid-1940s.
A striking example of Henningsen's craftsmanship, this armchair is characterized by the elegant construction of the walnut frame with its slanted back and wooden armrests. The fully sprung seat and sensible dimensions make this a very comfortable chair to sit in.
25ʺW × 34ʺD × 42ʺH
Free delivery in the tri-state area

seating.Name: 1950s Hans J. Wegner Sawbuck Chairs - Set of 6
seating.Body:
Hans J. Wegner for Carl Hansen & Søn, set of six 'Sawbuck' CH29 chairs, oak, teak, Denmark, 1952. This set of six chairs is designed by Hans J. Wegner for Carl Hansen. This chair holds a very strong construction even though it has a simplistic design. The chair only consists of eight parts. The chairs are defined by the V-shaped gaps in the backrest. The chair has a slightly slanted position, making the chair more comfortable than it looks. A number of chairs by Wegner are called sawbuck chairs, or 'bukkestole' in Danish. These chairs, which are closely related to folding chairs, but yet fixed in an open position. The chair is defined by the A-shaped frame that can be seen from the side. The name derives from the shape that sawbucks or sawhorses in his workshop. The sawbuck shape was something that many cabinetmakers were very interested in. The design is very strong and simple and only demands a few part and little material.

tables.Name: 1930s Antique French Carved Leg Flip-Top Game Table
tables.Body:
Characterized by the French-inspired cabriolet legs, this rare card table is a simple exquisite example of the wealth of perspective that was considered in designing a piece. The simple top is a rich selection with a dense grain that glows in the polished patina of the single plank. Typical of the form, the back leg swings outward on knuckle joints The simple rounded edge and restrained approach to decoration speak to the taste of the original owner of the table, clearly someone with a well developed taste for the latest forms but with a more conservative eye for surface decoration.

tables.Name: Danish Cabinetmaker Art Deco Cocktail Table, Circa 1940s
tables.Body: This exceptional and rare cocktail or side table is an instant statement piece. Expertly constructed of stained beechwood, it features a glass top and sculptural tripod legs that flare slightly at the base, drawing the eye downwards to brushed brass rod stretchers for a touch of Old Hollywood glamour. Undoubtedly produced by a skilled Danish cabinetmaker, this table is bears strong resemblance to others of the period attributed to Slagelse Mobelvaerk.
